result.execSummary:
The defendant Lawrence J. Sowatzke III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.

Counseling as deemed appropriate by the agent.
Letter of apology to the victim in a mode and manner determined by the agent, pre-approved by the agent, due within 30 days.
These conditions apply to Ct. 4 as well.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Lawrence J. Sowatzke III
Current: N671 County Road M, Flambeau Correctional Center, Hawkins, WI 54530 United States  (Effective: 09-22-2015)
Prior: 127 N. 7th Street - Apt. A, Medford, WI 54451
Daniel T. Cveykus - Unable to Forward

Defendant Lawrence J. Sowatzke in court with attorney Daniel T. Cveykus.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement placed on the record by Ms. Tlusty.  State moved to amend the repeater enhancer to 939.62(1)(a) - granted. DE entered a plea of no contest to Cts. 3 and 4.  Plea colloquy.  Court found plea given freely, voluntarily, and intellingently; accepted plea; found DE guilty and ordered entry of JOC.  Pursuant to the agreement Cts. 1 and 2 are dismissed and read in.  Brief statements by counsel and defendant. Court withheld sentence and placed defendant on probation for 2 years with the following conditions on each count:  payment of court costs; DNA surcharge of $200.00 on Ct. 1 only; counseling as deemed appropriate by the agent; and write a letter of apology to the victim within 30 days and pre-approved by the agent.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 18, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
Letter to Sheriff's Department with Bond

*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.  Defendant shall have no contact with J.D.L. dob: 01-31-1998.
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

Defendant Lawrence J. Sowatzke in court with attorney Daniel T Cveykus.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Further reading of complaint waived.  Preliminary hearing requested;  Motion filed for revocation of the signature bond and request a cash bond be set.  Argument by Mr. Cveykus.  Court modified the signature bond to a $2000 cash bond with the same conditions.  Time limits waived for the preliminary hearing.  PTC set.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 14, 2014 at 11:00 am.

*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure. Defendant shall have no contact with J.D.L. dob: 01-31-1998.

Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant appeared in court in custody. Court found probable cause for the arrest. Court advised DE of possible charges and penalties. Court advised DE of right to attorney.  Notice of right to attorney given to defendant.  State requested a $2,000.00 cash bond with conditions of: comply with booking and no contact with J.D.L. dob: 01-31-1998.  Response by DE.  Court ordered a $2000 signature bond with conditions as requested.  Initial appearance set for 01-21-2014 at 1:30 p.m.
